timeline.message:
1. isReturnTag method modify, the condition 'es.length == 2' is not reasonable. For example: returnedObj.0.info
2. @Tag evaluationReturnContext modify, add Map, List, Array
3. add @Tag test case .

timeline.bodyText: Are there possibilities that the method returns a String and the user wants to use that as a tag? In such case, es.length == 1
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText:
Are there possibilities that the method returns a String and the user wants to use that as a tag? In such case, es.length == 1

Uh, there is a problem here. When returning objects such as numbers, strings, Boolean values, characters, etc., they need to be processed, otherwise the tag value will be null. Whether to handle only common types such as numbers, strings, Boolean values, and characters.
replies.author: zoumingzm

replies.bodyText:

Uh, there is a problem here. When returning objects such as numbers, strings, Boolean values, characters, etc., they need to be processed, otherwise the tag value will be null. Whether to handle only common types such as numbers, strings, Boolean values, and characters.

What about simply call toString on the returnedObj
